textareas.textarea: to-report probability-death [ x ] if x >= 0 and x <= 4 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_0to4 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 9 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_5to9 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 14 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_10to14 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 19 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_15to19 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 24 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_20to24 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 29 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_25to29 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 34 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_30to34 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 39 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_35to39 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 44 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_40to44 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 49 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_45to49 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] if x <= 54 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_50to54 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] ifelse x <= 59 [ report ( ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1 - the-mortality_55to59 ) ) * the-mortmult ) ] [ report ( - 1 / 5 * ln ( 1.01 - the-mortality_60plus ) ) ] end
Begin description:Add any NetLogo command including those that define a new reporter or command to NetLogo. End descriptionmortality as histogram reporter

model.infoTab:
## WHAT IS IT?
(a general understanding of what the model is trying to show or explain)
## HOW IT WORKS
(what rules the agents use to create the overall behavior of the model)
## HOW TO USE IT
(how to use the model, including a description of each of the items in the Interface tab)
## THINGS TO NOTICE
(suggested things for the user to notice while running the model)
## THINGS TO TRY
(suggested things for the user to try to do (move sliders, switches, etc.) with the model)
## EXTENDING THE MODEL
(suggested things to add or change in the Code tab to make the model more complicated, detailed, accurate, etc.)
## NETLOGO FEATURES
(interesting or unusual features of NetLogo that the model uses, particularly in the Code tab; or where workarounds were needed for missing features)
## RELATED MODELS
(models in the NetLogo Models Library and elsewhere which are of related interest)
## CREDITS AND REFERENCES
(a reference to the model's URL on the web if it has one, as well as any other necessary credits, citations, and links)
